ETYMOLOGY: From Middle English delaier, from Old French delaier, equivalent to de- (away, off) + laier (to leave, let).

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To make someone or something late or slow down the progress of something.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 推迟；耽搁；使（某人或某事）迟缓。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Traffic congestion delayed the delivery of the goods by several hours.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 交通堵塞使货物交付延迟了几个小时。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To put off action until a later time; to wait or be slow in doing something.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: If you delay any further, we might lose the opportunity.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 如果你再拖延下去，我们可能会失去这个机会。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A period of time when something is held up or postponed; the amount of time by which something is late.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 延误；耽搁；延迟的时间或时段。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: There was a two-hour delay due to adverse weather conditions.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 由于恶劣的天气条件，出现了两小时的延误。
